headline: D.R. Horton (DHI): Assessing Valuation as Stock Diverges from Broader Market Trends
summary: D.R. Horton (DHI) has attracted interest lately as its stock performance diverges from broader market trends. Investors have been analyzing recent returns and financial metrics, looking for signals about where the homebuilder might head next. See our latest analysis for D.R. Horton. The past year has been a rollercoaster for D.R. Horton, with recent momentum showing signs of cooling. Its 1-year total shareholder return is down 11.5%, even as the share price moved up 14.8% since January...

headline: D.R. Horton’s Earnings Will Offer Hint About Housing Market Demand. What to Watch.
summary: Investors have a limited read on demand for new homes as the government shutdown rolls on.  The Arlington, Tex.-based  D.R. Horton  the largest U.S. builder by market capitalization, will report its fourth quarter results on Tuesday before the market opens.  Analysts expect that the builder earned $3.27 a share on about $9.4 billion in revenue in its fourth quarter, and $11.82 a share on $34 billion for the full year, according to FactSet.
